result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

ADDRESS INFO for Travis E Johnson
Current: 115 W Doty St, c/o Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703   (Effective: 06-02-2022)
Prior: 4637 Atticus Way Apt 108, Madison, WI 53711

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer P.E. duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA Verhoff. Venue established. DE identified. No cross. State moves for b/o, waives argument. DE objects to b/o, waives argument. Ct finds PC felony was committed and binds case over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sarah M-R. 
- Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle not registered to the defendant without written consent from the lawful owner on their person. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:41 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
